title: Hyperparameter tuning
text: first step use tfevents log hyperparameter tuning experiments log hyperparameter configuration using log_hparams_config() function. order , need first define set hyperparameters going experiment along domains. also define set metrics want displayed HParams dashboard. Suppose want tune neural network following hyperparameters: num_units, dropout optimizer. want observe training validation loss well accuracy. can now choose logdir log hyperparameter configurations: now logged experiment configuration, can now proceed loging runs experiment.
code: hparams <- list(   hparams_hparam("num_units", domain = c(128, 256, 512)),   hparams_hparam("dropout", domain = c(min_value = 0.1, max_value = 0.4)),   hparams_hparam("optimizer", domain = c("sgd", "adam")) )  metrics <- list(   hparams_metric("loss", group = "train"),   hparams_metric("loss", group = "valid"),   hparams_metric("accuracy", group = "train"),   hparams_metric("accuracy", group = "valid") ) temp <- tempfile("logdir") local_logdir(temp) log_hparams_config(hparams, metrics)

title: Hyperparameter tuning
text: actually going train model tutorial, define function log metrics, like training something. function takes hyperparameter values, used configure training happens. now writer wraper function takes hyperparameter values : Creates random logdir name run Temporarily modifies default logdir, scalars etc run separated file system. Log set hyperparameters going used. Runs train function defined earlier. can now use run_train run training multiple sets hyperparameters. can see root logdir using temp filled event files. Finally, can visualize experiment results TensorBoard: screenshot shows table view HParams dashboard TensorBoard.  TensorBoard also provides visualizing results parallel coordinates plot scatter plot.
code: train <- function(num_units, dropout, optimizer) {   # each run will have its own logdir.   # this modifies the logdir during the execution of this function   epochs <- 10   for (i in seq_len(epochs)) {     # training code would go here     log_event(       train = list(loss = runif(1), accuracy = runif(1)),       valid = list(loss = runif(1), accuracy = runif(1)),     )   } } run_train <- function(root_logdir, num_units, dropout, optimizer) {   # create a random logdir name for the run. It should be a child directory   # of root_logdir   logdir <- file.path(     root_logdir,     paste(sample(letters, size = 15, replace = TRUE), collapse = "")   )      # modifies the logdir during the execution of run_train   local_logdir(logdir)       # before running the actual training we log the set of hyperparameters   # that are used.   log_hparams(     num_units = num_units,     dropout = dropout,     optimizer = optimizer   )      train(num_units, dropout, optimizer) } for (num_units in c(128, 256, 512)) {   for (dropout in c(0.1, 0.25)) {     for (optimizer in c("adam", "sgd")) {       run_train(temp, num_units, dropout, optimizer)     }   } } fs::dir_tree(temp) #> /tmp/RtmpT29Lyg/logdir3d6d75a95bd9 #> ├── azfkvgdulervtrn #> │   ├── events.out.tfevents.1668110577.v2 #> │   ├── train #> │   │   └── events.out.tfevents.1668110577.v2 #> │   └── valid #> │       └── events.out.tfevents.1668110577.v2 #> ├── coqzwufvbvchyyn #> │   ├── events.out.tfevents.1668110577.v2 #> │   ├── train #> │   │   └── events.out.tfevents.1668110577.v2 #> │   └── valid #> │       └── events.out.tfevents.1668110577.v2 #> ├── events.out.tfevents.1668110575.v2 #> ├── ewonexbkbbrysya #> │   ├── events.out.tfevents.1668110576.v2 #> │   ├── train #> │   │   └── events.out.tfevents.1668110576.v2 #> │   └── valid #> │       └── events.out.tfevents.1668110576.v2 #> ├── fjodvuryrxokacl #> │   ├── title: Authors and Citation
text: Falbel D (2022). tfevents: Package (One Line, Title Case). https://github.com/mlverse/tfevents, https://mlverse.github.io/tfevents/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {tfevents: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)},   author = {Daniel Falbel},   year = {2022},   note = {https://github.com/mlverse/tfevents, https://mlverse.github.io/tfevents/}, }

what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: tfevents allows logging data machine learning experiments file format can later consumed TensorBoard order generate visualizations.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: can install development version tfevents GitHub : Note: Currently MacOS Linux supported. Windows support coming soon! need cmake path. See installation instructions cmake install webpage - : use brew MacOS can run: linux install cmake library, example Debian systems:
code: brew install cmake sudo apt install cmake # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("mlverse/tfevents")

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: main entrypoint tfevents API log_event function. can used log summaries like scalars, images, audio (Coming soon), histograms (Coming soon) arbitrary tensors (soon) log directory, like call logdir. can later point TensorBoard logdir visualize results. Summaries always associated step TensorBoard API, log_event automatically increases step everytime ’s called, unless provide step argument. Let’s start logging metrics: default create logs directory working directory write metrics - can change default logdir using context like with_logdir globally set_default_logdir(). Since passed nested list metrics, log_event create subdirectories logs write metrics group. can later point TensorBoard logdir using TensorBoard’s command line interface tensorflow’s utility function tensorboard() TensorBoard display results dashbboard, similar one can see screenshot :  can learn tfevents website.
code: library(tfevents) epochs <- 10 for (i in seq_len(epochs)) {   # training code would go here   log_event(     train = list(loss = runif(1), acc = runif(1)),     valid = list(loss = runif(1), acc = runif(1))   ) } fs::dir_tree("logs") #> logs #> ├── train #> │   └── events.out.tfevents.1668024224.v2 #> └── valid #>     └── events.out.tfevents.1668024224.v2 tensorflow::tensorboard(normalizePath("logs"), port = 6060) #> Loaded Tensorflow version 2.10.0 #> Started TensorBoard at http://127.0.0.1:6060

code: as_event(x, step, wall_time, ...)

title: Coerce an object to a event. — as_event
text: x Object coerced event. step step used event logged. used TensorBoard showing data. wall_time time event appended event. field used TensorBoard displaying information based actual time. ... currently unused.

title: Coerce an object to a event. — as_event
text: event vctr class <tfevents_event>.

title: Coerce an object to a event. — as_event
text: as_event S3 generic can implement method class. export event constructor though, implement terms as_event methods.

title: Coerce an object to a event. — as_event
code: as_event(list(hello = 1), step = 1, wall_time = 1) #> <tfevents_event[1]> #> [1] <./1>

title: Creates events — event
text: try match events closely possible protobuf messages. hierarchy looks like:
code: event (<event>):  - run (<character>)  - wall_time (<integer>)  - step (<integer>)  - summary (<summary> aka list_of<summary_values>):     - values (list):       - <summary_value>:         - metadata (<summary_metadata>)         - tag (<character>)         - value (<numeric>)         - image (<summary_summary_image>)           - buffer (<blob>)           - width (<integer>)           - height (<integer>)           - colorspace (<integer>)

title: Creates events — event
code: event(run, wall_time, step, ..., summary = NA, file_version = NA)

what: Query and modify the logdir — get_default_logdir
title: Query and modify the logdir — get_default_logdir
text: log_event() notion default logdir, need specify every call. functions allow query current logdir.

title: Query and modify the logdir — get_default_logdir
code: get_default_logdir()  set_default_logdir(logdir = "logs")  with_logdir(logdir, code)  local_logdir(logdir, .env = parent.frame())

title: Query and modify the logdir — get_default_logdir
text: logdir logdir want set default. code Expressions evaluated context new logdir default logdir. .env Environment controls scope changes. expert use .

title: Query and modify the logdir — get_default_logdir
text: logdir get_default_logdir() otherwise invisibly returns NULL

title: Query and modify the logdir — get_default_logdir
text: set_default_logdir(): Modifies default logdir. with_logdir(): Temporarily modify default logdir. local_logdir(): Temporarily modify thedefault logdir.

title: Query and modify the logdir — get_default_logdir
code: temp <- tempfile() get_default_logdir() #> [1] "logs" with_logdir(temp, {  print(get_default_logdir()) }) #> [1] "/tmp/RtmpfRvkpv/file3c197ef31ca"

title: Global step counters — get_global_step
text: Global step counters

title: Global step counters — get_global_step
code: get_global_step(increment = TRUE)  set_global_step(step)

title: Global step counters — get_global_step
text: increment Wether increment step getting . step New value step.

title: Global step counters — get_global_step
text: global step value default logdir, get_global_step, otherwise returns NULL invisibly.

title: Global step counters — get_global_step
text: tfevents tracks automatically increased step counter whenever log_event() called. Note , maintains separate step counter root logdir, thus change logdir using set_default_logdir() with_logdir(), different step counter used.

title: Global step counters — get_global_step
text: set_global_step(): Set global step.

title: Global step counters — get_global_step
code: temp <- tempfile() with_logdir(temp, {   print(get_global_step())   set_global_step(100)   print(get_global_step()) }) #> [1] 0 #> [1] 101 print(get_global_step()) #> [1] 0

title: Defines a HParam — hparams_hparam
text: Hparam object used describe names domains hyperparameters TensorBoard UI can show additional information .

title: Defines a HParam — hparams_hparam
code: hparams_hparam(name, domain = NA, display_name = name, description = name)

title: Defines a HParam — hparams_hparam
text: name Name hyperparameter. domain list values can assumed hyperparameter. can character(), numeric() logical() vector. can also pass named numeric vector eg c(min_value = 0, max_value = 10) case, value range accepted. display_name Display name hparameter TensorBoard UI. default identical name. description Parameter description. Shown tooltips around TensorBoard UI.

title: Defines a HParam — hparams_hparam
text: hparams_hparam object.

title: Defines a HParam — hparams_hparam
text: list hparam values can passed log_hparams_config() define hyperparameters tracked experiment.

title: Defines a HParam — hparams_hparam
code: hparams_hparam("optimizer", domain = c("adam", "sgd")) #> $name #> [1] "optimizer" #>  #> $domain #> [1] "adam" "sgd"  #>  #> $display_name #> [1] "optimizer" #>  #> $description #> [1] "optimizer" #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "hparams_hparam" hparams_hparam("num_units", domain = c(128, 512, 1024)) #> $name #> [1] "num_units" #>  #> $domain #> [1]  128  512 1024 #>  #> $display_name #> [1] "num_units" #>  #> $description #> [1] "num_units" #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "hparams_hparam" hparams_hparam("use_cnn", domain = c(TRUE, FALSE)) #> $name #> [1] "use_cnn" #>  #> $domain #> [1]  TRUE FALSE #>  #> $display_name #> [1] "use_cnn" #>  #> $description #> [1] "use_cnn" #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "hparams_hparam" hparams_hparam("dropout", domain = c(min_value = 0, max_value = 0.5)) #> $name #> [1] "dropout" #>  #> $domain #> min_value max_value  #>       0.0       0.5  #>  #> $display_name #> [1] "dropout" #>  #> $description #> [1] "dropout" #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "hparams_hparam"

title: Defines a Metric — hparams_metric
text: Metric objects passed log_hparams_config() order define collection scalars displayed HParams tab TensorBoard.

title: Defines a Metric — hparams_metric
code: hparams_metric(   tag,   group = NA,   display_name = tag,   description = tag,   dataset_type = NA )

title: Defines a Metric — hparams_metric
text: tag tag name scalar summary corresponds metric. group optional string listing subdirectory session's log directory containing summaries metric. instance, summaries training runs written events files ROOT_LOGDIR/SESSION_ID/train, group "train". Defaults empty string: .e., summaries expected written session logdir. display_name optional human-readable display name. description optional Markdown string human-readable description metric, appear TensorBoard. dataset_type dataset_type: Either "training" "validation, NA.

title: Defines a Metric — hparams_metric
text: hparams_metric object.

title: Defines a Metric — hparams_metric
code: hparams_metric("loss", group = "train") #> $tag #> [1] "loss" #>  #> $group #> [1] "train" #>  #> $display_name #> [1] "loss" #>  #> $description #> [1] "loss" #>  #> $dataset_type #> [1] "unknown" #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "hparams_metric" hparams_metric("acc") #> $tag #> [1] "acc" #>  #> $group #> [1] NA #>  #> $display_name #> [1] "acc" #>  #> $description #> [1] "acc" #>  #> $dataset_type #> [1] "unknown" #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "hparams_metric"

text: Log event

code: log_event(..., step = get_global_step(increment = TRUE))

title: Log event — log_event
text: ... Named values want log. can possibly nested, case, enclosing names considered 'run' names TensorBoard. step step associated logs. NULL, managed step counter used, global step increased every call log_event().

title: Log event — log_event
text: Invisibly returns logged data.

title: Log event — log_event
text: log_event() writes events default logdir. can query default logdir get_default_logdir() modify set_default_logdir(). can also use with_logdir() context switcher temporarily modify logdir.

title: Log event — log_event
code: temp <- tempfile() with_logdir(temp, {   log_event(      train = list(loss = runif(1), acc = runif(1)),      valid = list(loss = runif(1), acc = runif(1))   ) })

title: Log hyperaparameters — log_hparams
text: Log hyperaparameters

title: Log hyperaparameters — log_hparams
code: log_hparams(..., trial_id = NA, time_created_secs = get_wall_time())  summary_hparams(..., trial_id = NA, time_created_secs = get_wall_time())

title: Log hyperaparameters — log_hparams
text: ... Named values hyperparameters. trial_id name current trail. default hash hparams names values. time_created_secs time experiment created seconds since UNIX epoch.

title: Log hyperaparameters — log_hparams
text: hyperparameter summary. USed side effects logging hyperparameter logdir.

title: Log hyperaparameters — log_hparams
text: function called logdir record set hyperparameters used run. Undefined behavior can happen called logdir - specially TensorBoard behaves visualization.

title: Log hyperaparameters — log_hparams
text: summary_hparams(): advanced users . recommended use log_hparams() function instead. Creates hyperparameter summary can written log_event().

title: Log hyperaparameters — log_hparams
code: temp <- tempfile() with_logdir(temp, {   log_hparams(optimizer = "adam", num_units = 16) })

title: Logs hyperparameters configuration — log_hparams_config
text: Logs hyperaparameter configuration HyperParameter tuning experiment. allows define domain hyperparameters metrics shown TensorBoard UI, along configuring display name descriptions.

title: Logs hyperparameters configuration — log_hparams_config
code: log_hparams_config(hparams, metrics, time_created_secs = get_wall_time())  summary_hparams_config(hparams, metrics, time_created_secs = get_wall_time())

title: Logs hyperparameters configuration — log_hparams_config
text: hparams list hparams objects created hparams_hparam(). metrics list metrics objects created hparams_metric(). metrics tracked TensorBoard UI displaying hyperparameter tuning table. time_created_secs time experiment created seconds since UNIX epoch.

title: Logs hyperparameters configuration — log_hparams_config
text: summary_hparams_config(): advanced users . Creates hyperaparameter configuration summary can logged log_event().

title: Logs hyperparameters configuration — log_hparams_config
text: loging hyperparameter tuning experiments, log directory organization :   Ie root logdir contain hyperaparameter config log, created log_hparams_config(). run experiment logdir child directory root logdir.
code: - root:  - log_hparams_config(...)  - run1:    - log_hparams(...)    - log_event(...)  - run2:    - log_hparams(...)    - log_event(...)

title: Creates a image summary — summary_image
text: Creates image summary

title: Creates a image summary — summary_image
code: summary_image(img, ..., metadata = NULL, tag = NA)  # S3 method for ggplot summary_image(img, ..., width = NA, height = NA, metadata = NULL, tag = NA)  # S3 method for array summary_image(img, ..., metadata = NULL, tag = NA)  # S3 method for blob summary_image(img, ..., width, height, colorspace, metadata = NULL, tag = NA)  # S3 method for raw summary_image(img, ..., width, height, colorspace, metadata = NULL, tag = NA)

title: Creates a image summary — summary_image
text: img object can converted image. ... Currently unused. metadata metadata object, created summary_metadata(). cases need change default. tag tag within TensorBoard UI. See log_event() ways specifying tag attribute. width Width image. height Height image. colorspace Valid colorspace values 1 - grayscale, 2 - grayscale + alpha, 3 - RGB, 4 - RGBA, 5 - DIGITAL_YUV, 6 - BGRA

title: Creates a image summary — summary_image
text: summary_image(ggplot): Cretes image summary ggplot2 graph object. ... forwarded ggplot2::ggsave(). summary_image(array): Creates image R array. array numeric, values 0 1. Dimensions (batch, height, width, channels). summary_image(blob): Creates image blob::blob() vctr PNG encoded images, (eg using png::writePNG()). width, height colorspace recycled thus can single scalar vector size images blob. summary_image(raw): Creates image png encoded image. Eg, created png::writePNG(). case need provide width, height colorspace arguments.

title: Summary metadata — summary_metadata
text: Creates summary metadata can passed multiple summary_ functions.

title: Summary metadata — summary_metadata
code: summary_metadata(   plugin_name,   display_name = NA_character_,   description = NA_character_,   ...,   plugin_content = NA )

title: Summary metadata — summary_metadata
text: plugin_name name TensorBoard plugin might use summary. display_name Display name summary. description description summary. ... Currently unused. future expansion. plugin_content optional plugin content. Note used C++ function make_plugin_data aware plugin_content specified plugin name. advanced use .

title: Summary metadata — summary_metadata
text: summary_metadata object.

title: Summary metadata — summary_metadata
code: summary <- summary_scalar(1, metadata = summary_metadata("scalars"))

title: Scalar event — summary_scalar
code: temp <- tempfile() with_logdir(temp, {   log_event(loss = summary_scalar(1)) })
